rooms.description: Open-plan living room with floor-to-ceiling windows on the west facade for natural light, designed in a Scandinavian style with minimalistic furniture and neutral color palette. It is wheelchair accessible with wide doorways and no steps.
Modern kitchen integrated into the living area with Scandinavian design elements. Equipped with low countertops for accessibility and designed to allow natural light from adjoining windows.
Cozy dining space adjacent to the kitchen, featuring a minimalist table setting, ample maneuvering space and integrated storage solutions.

Multipurpose studio area combining work and relaxation zones. The design includes an ergonomic layout ensuring ease of movement for wheelchair users, with open floor plan and adaptable furniture arrangements.
Wheelchair accessible bathroom designed with Scandinavian simplicity, featuring a roll-in shower, grab bars, low sink counters, and open space design.

openings.description: Floor-to-ceiling windows for ample natural light and ventilation, with Vastu consideration ensuring energy flow. The window placement aligns with the west-facing orientation.
Accessible entrance door designed to accommodate wheelchair users with automatic opening mechanism and threshold-free entry.
